benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/auditLogs - Retrieve audit logs by account id

covered: Valid Request: Successful retrieval for an existing account is covered (TC01, TC13).
Empty Response: Scenarios verifying behavior when there are no audit logs are covered (TC02, TC12).
Input Validation: Malformed UUID, empty accountId and injection attempts are tested (TC04, TC10, TC15).
Authorization (basic): Missing and invalid authentication token cases are covered (TC05, TC06).
Error Handling: 404 (account not found) and 500 (system/db error) are covered (TC03, TC08).
Edge / Resilience: Timeouts, system under heavy load, concurrent requests and large payload/performance are covered (TC09, TC11, TC14).
Query Parameters (basic): Behavior with an extra/unknown query parameter is tested (TC07).
Regression & Compatibility: Specific regression case and backward-compatibility for older clients are present (TC12, TC13).
Response metadata: Content-Type assertion is present in success scenario (TC01).
Response schema: Tests assert that AuditLog objects contain required fields (TC01).
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination (limit/offset/page size), paging headers (Link, next, prev) or behavior when result set is split across pages (despite TC09 creating a large dataset).
Query Parameters (coverage): Only one “extra” query param is tested. There are no tests for valid/invalid filter/sort/pagination parameters, or combinations of query parameters.
Authorization depth: Tests cover unauthenticated requests (401) but not authorization/permission failures (403) or token expiry/insufficient scope scenarios.

Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests assert 429 responses or system behavior under high request rates (rate limit exceeded). Concurrent requests (TC14) test concurrency but do not verify rate-limit enforcement or backoff behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests resulting in 304 Not Modified.
Conditional GET / Idempotence: No tests for If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since behavior or validation of cache-related semantics.
Response headers & content negotiation: Apart from Content-Type in one test, headers like Cache-Control, ETag, Vary, and behavior for different Accept headers are not validated.
Schema/type rigor: While required fields are checked, there are no tests validating field types, formats, or complete schema conformance (e.g., даты, enums, nested object validation).
Error body schema consistency: Tests assert an error message exists but do not validate consistent error body structure or error codes within the body.
Rate/Performance boundaries: TC09 asserts a response time threshold for 10,000 items but there are no load/stress tests that vary dataset size and concurrency to define acceptable boundaries.
Negative/invalid query params: No tests for malformed query parameter values (e.g., limit=abc, page=-1).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include limit/offset or page parameters, test default page size, verify paging headers (Link, next, prev) and correct slicing of results across pages. Include tests for requests retrieving page 1, middle page and last page.
Expand query-parameter coverage: add tests for valid/invalid filter and sort params, combinations of params, and malformed values (e.g., limit=abc, sort=unknown).
Add authorization scope tests: include 403 cases for authenticated but unauthorized clients, expired tokens, and tokens with insufficient scopes/roles.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst requests to verify 429 responses and proper Retry-After headers; include sustained high-rate scenarios to ensure graceful throttling.

Add caching/conditional GET tests: assert presence and correctness of ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers, and verify If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since behavior producing 304 responses when appropriate.

Validate response schema strictly: add tests that assert field types/formats (e.g., timestamp formats, enum values) and use JSON Schema validation against the API definition for both success and error responses.
Standardize error responses: add tests that validate consistent error payload structure (error code, message, details) across 4xx/5xx scenarios.
Add negative/robustness tests: malformed headers, very long accountId strings, unexpected characters, and additional injection/fuzzing cases beyond the single example.
Add load/performance matrix: vary dataset sizes and concurrent connections to map performance characteristics and document acceptable SLAs instead of a single hard threshold.
Add caching and CDN interaction tests if applicable: verify behavior when responses are served through intermediate caches or CDNs and whether cache headers are correctly set/invalidated.
